Addressbook Documentation¶

This page contains the Addressbook Module documentation.

The addressbook Module¶

This module deal with the Address Book and its contacts.

class AddressBook(filename, api=None)¶

Bases: object

Class representing the Address Book of the application. The Address Book is written to disk an read back. The Address Book is mostly a dictionnary of Contact instances.

Filename must be given. The Address Book is save in file named ‘filename.adb’ in the directory ‘~/.filename/’.

add(name, address, port=None, auto_created=False, connector=None, setting=0)¶

Add a contact to the Address Book. Name and address are mandatory, port is optional and if connector is None, it will be deduce from the address type. Setting is set to 0 (base setting) by default.

Address, port and setting are validated and exception are raise on problems.

client_contact(address, port=None)¶
Create a temporary contact for the caller if he is not already in the Address Book. Contact are searched by address and port (optional).
delete(name=None)¶
Delete the named contact from the Address Book or the selected if no name is given.
duplicate(name=None, new_name=None)¶
Add a copy of the named contact in the Address Book and add the string ‘ (copy)’ to is name if no new name is given, else give the new name. If no name is given, copy the selected contact.
find_contact(address, port=None, connector=None)¶
Find a contact by its address and port.
get_contact(name=None)¶
Return the named contact instance or raise an Exception if it doesn’t exist.
get_current()¶
Return the selected contact or return None if none is selected.
modify(name=None, new_name=None, address=None, port=None, connector=None)¶
Change one or more attributes of a contact. If no name is given, modify the selected contact.
read()¶
Read the Address Book file (.adb) from the disk.
save_client_contact(name=None, new_name=None)¶
Saved permanently an auto created contact to the Address Book. If no name is given, the selected is use. If new_name is given the contact will be saved under this new name.
select(name)¶
Select one contact in the Address Book (by name). It become the ‘active’ contact.
write(state=True)¶
Write back to disk the Address Book. Raise error on problems.
class Contact(name, address, port=None, auto_created=False, connector=None, setting=0)¶

Bases: object

Class representing a contact in the address book

Name and address are mandatory, port is optional and if connector is None, it will be deduce from the address type. Setting is set to 0 (base setting) by default.

Name, address, port and setting are validated and exception are raise on problems.

assign_connector(connector=None)¶

Set the connector use by this contact. Connector should be a string. If none is given, one is deduce from the address kind. Matching rules can be change in the future.

Parameters:
  • connector (string or None) – Should be a valid connector
set_address(address)¶
Set the address attribute of the contact in function of is kind (group or others).
set_kind(address)¶

Validate the given address, find is kind then set it.

Kinds:
group:a list of contact names
sip_name:name@www.domain.org
sip_ip:name@123.123.123.123
ip:123.123.123.123
multicast:[224-239].123.123.123

If the address did not validate an exception is raise.

set_port(port)¶
Validate and set the port of the contact. If the port did not validate, an exception is raised. Port should be in between 1024 and 65535. The port given could be an integer, a string or a unicode string. If the port given is an empty string or the int 0, the port is set to None.
ip_range(address)¶
Validate that each number of an IP address is between 0 and 255. The address should be a string of the format ‘123.123.123.123’.
